issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
After upgrading from 4.3.1 to 4.4.2, the existing loadbalancers are failing to upgrade. This issue appears to be related to EUCA-13335 and causing other issues with upgradeing the ELB service.

The following error is reported in {{cloud-debug.log}} on the UFS node running the loadbalancing service:
{noformat}
Mon Oct 23 20:02:46 2017 ERROR [LoadBalancingWorkflows:eucalyptus-loadbalancing-ephemeralconfiguration-loadbalancing-topology-10.93.4.59-api_59.loadbalancing-worker-1048] Failed to run upgrade-loadbalancer workflow
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.model.WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedException: Status Code: 400, AWS Service: AmazonSimpleWorkflow, AWS Request ID: 96305d4a-d35c-4f95-aaa8-7ec2626ecc27, AWS
 Error Code: WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedFault, AWS Error Message: Workflow open with ID upgrade-loadbalancer-workflow-01
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.report(FutureTask.java:122)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:192)
        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.workflow.LoadBalancingWorkflows.runUpgradeLoadBalancerWorkflowSync(LoadBalancingWorkflows.java:360)
        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.LoadBalancingServiceBootstrapper.runUpgradeLoadBalancerWorkflow(LoadBalancingServiceBootstrapper.java:172)
        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.LoadBalancingServiceBootstrapper.check(LoadBalancingServiceBootstrapper.java:94)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper$BootstrapperTransition$7.runBootstrapper(Component.java:725)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper$BootstrapperTransition.apply(Component.java:734)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper$BootstrapperTransition$7.apply(Component.java:722)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper.doTransition(Component.java:640)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper.doTransition(Component.java:627)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper.check(Component.java:773)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions$ServiceLocalTransitionCallbacks$3.fire(ServiceTransitions.java:649)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions.processTransition(ServiceTransitions.java:360)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions.access$000(ServiceTransitions.java:123)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions$TransitionActions.leave(ServiceTransitions.java:412)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions$TransitionActions.leave(ServiceTransitions.java:379)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.TransitionImpl.leave(TransitionImpl.java:218)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.AtomicMarkedState$ActiveTransition.leave(AtomicMarkedState.java:524)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.AtomicMarkedState.afterLeave(AtomicMarkedState.java:342)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.AtomicMarkedState.transition(AtomicMarkedState.java:185)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceState.transition(ServiceState.java:136)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceState.transition(ServiceState.java:83)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.Automata$1.call(Automata.java:141)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.Automata$1.call(Automata.java:126)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.Futures$3.call(Futures.java:194)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.Futures$3.call(Futures.java:181)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions.executeTransition(ServiceTransitions.java:317)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions.pathTo(ServiceTransitions.java:183)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$TopologyChange.doTopologyChange(Topology.java:1309)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$TopologyChange.apply(Topology.java:1300)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$Transitions.apply(Topology.java:1272)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$Transitions$2.apply(Topology.java:1206)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$Transitions$2.apply(Topology.java:1198)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$8.call(Topology.java:1151)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$8.call(Topology.java:1139)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at com.eucalyptus.system.Threads$Queue$EucaFutureTask.run(Threads.java:729)
        at com.eucalyptus.system.Threads$Queue.run(Threads.java:786)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.model.WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedException: Status Code: 400, AWS Service: AmazonSimpleWorkflow, AWS Request ID: 96305d4a-d35c-4f95-aaa8-7ec2626ecc27, AWS Error Code: WorkflowExecution
AlreadyStartedFault, AWS Error Message: Workflow open with ID upgrade-loadbalancer-workflow-01
        at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.handleErrorResponse(AmazonHttpClient.java:773)
        at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.executeHelper(AmazonHttpClient.java:417)
        at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.execute(AmazonHttpClient.java:229)
        at com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.AmazonSimpleWorkflowClient.invoke(AmazonSimpleWorkflowClient.java:3144)
        at com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.AmazonSimpleWorkflowClient.startWorkflowExecution(AmazonSimpleWorkflowClient.java:939)
        at com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.flow.worker.GenericWorkflowClientExternalImpl.startWorkflow(GenericWorkflowClientExternalImpl.java:62)
        at com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.flow.DynamicWorkflowClientExternalImpl.startWorkflowExecution(DynamicWorkflowClientExternalImpl.java:152)
        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.workflow.UpgradeLoadBalancerWorkflowClientExternalImpl.upgradeLoadBalancer(UpgradeLoadBalancerWorkflowClientExternalImpl.java:33)
        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.workflow.UpgradeLoadBalancerWorkflowClientExternalImpl.upgradeLoadBalancer(UpgradeLoadBalancerWorkflowClientExternalImpl.java:26)
        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.workflow.LoadBalancingWorkflows$10.call(LoadBalancingWorkflows.java:373)
        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.workflow.LoadBalancingWorkflows$10.call(LoadBalancingWorkflows.java:368)
        ... 8 more
Mon Oct 23 20:02:46 2017 ERROR [LoadBalancingServiceBootstrapper:eucalyptus-loadbalancing-ephemeralconfiguration-loadbalancing-topology-10.93.4.59-api_59.loadbalancing-worker-1048] Failed to upgrade old loadbalancers. Will retry...
{noformat}

I have already confirmed the EMI ID of the loadbalancers updated correctly by verifying the image ID of the ASGs in the (eucalyptus)loadbalancing account. The worker image ID is also set correctly.

comments.body:
A failure to start an upgrade workflow because one is already running may not require any action. If you do not see the iam role policy for each load balancer being updated then action may be required.

To check the role policy that is currently in use for each load balancer you would do the following as cloud administrator:

{code}
#
# euare-rolelistbypath --as-account '(eucalyptus)loadbalancing' -p '/internal/loadbalancer/' 
arn:aws:iam::000966976374:role/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm-000702914980-balancer-8
arn:aws:iam::000966976374:role/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm-000702914980-balancer-7
#
#
# euare-rolegetpolicy --as-account '(eucalyptus)loadbalancing' -p euca-internal-loadbalancer-vm-policy loadbalancer-vm-000702914980-balancer-8
{"Statement":[{"Action": ["swf:PollForActivityTask", "swf:RegisterActivityType", "swf:RespondActivityTaskCanceled", "swf:RespondActivityTaskCompleted", "swf:RespondActivityTaskFailed", "swf:RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat"],"Effect": "Allow","Resource": "*"}]}
#
#
{code}

when the role policy is upgraded for each load balancer you will see the "swf" actions in the policy.

If all load balancers have the correct role policy then any upgrade workflow errors can be ignored.

As a follow-up, it seems the only way to recover from this issue was to delete and re-create all of our ELBs in our production system. While not ideal, we no longer have open SWF workflow tasks which remain open for hours hogging up the SWF threads to process jobs. The ability to update/create/modify/delete ELBs is now functional on all ELBs created post 4.4.2 upgrade.
